alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 2:53PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MCINTOSH AND CENTRAL MUSKOGEE COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM CDT... At 253 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of Stidham, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Checotah... Oktaha... Council Hill... Rentiesville... Stidham... Lake Eufaula State Park... Hitchita... Pierce... Onapa... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 249 and 273. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
